benchmark_details.name: FedOA (Federated Adapter on Foundation Models)
benchmark_details.overview: FedOA is a novel framework that adapts invariant learning for out-of-distribution (OOD) generalization in Federated Foundation Models (FedFM) using adapter-based parameter-efficient fine-tuning methods to enhance OOD generalization through feature distance-based regularization.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To address OOD generalization in Federated Foundation Models using personalized adapters and feature distance-based regularization.

data.source: Constructed federated datasets derived from the Flan dataset, each centered around distinct tasks and designed for federated settings.

methodology.calculation: Metrics were calculated based on the performance of personalized models during the federated learning process.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better generalization performance on OOD tasks.
methodology.baseline_results: FedOA demonstrated better OOD generalization than existing methods like FedIT, pFedMe, and FedLoRA.
methodology.validation: FedOA was validated through empirical experiments on benchmark datasets.
